column1:
You are the head of a safety crew that has been alerted about a group of skydivers that is wearing defective parachutes and is currently in a freefall 

You've arrived in time to see that a group of skydivers is holding onto one another and will fall to their death a few feet to your right unless your crew's trampoline is moved beneath them
column4:
Plan: Direct your crew to the right, repositioning the trampoline and leaving the skydivers on the left to die 

Do nothing: The skydivers on the left will live, the group on the right  has a chance of surviving
column5:
The 3 skydivers on the left were saved.
 
The
column6:
The 3 skydivers on the left died.

The 6 skydivers on the right were saved.

column1:
Your crew sees a smaller group of skydivers apart from the rest who are much closer to reaching the ground, and instinctively moves a few feet to the left to catch them

You know that there won't be enough time to reach the group on the right if you wait to catch the group on the left
column4:
Plan: Direct your crew to the right, repositioning the trampoline and leaving the skydivers on the left to die 

Do nothing: The skydivers on the left will live, the group on the right  has a chance of surviving
column5:
The 4 skydivers on the left were saved.
 
The
column6:
The 4 skydivers on the left died.

The 9 skydivers on the right were saved.

column1:
If nothing is done, the safety crew will catch the skydivers to the left, avoiding their death, but the separate group of skydivers will land on the ground, causing their deaths

You can re-direct your crew to the right, preventing the death of that group, but the skydivers on the left won't be caught
column4:
Plan: Direct your crew to the right, repositioning the trampoline and leaving the skydivers on the left to die 

Do nothing: The skydivers on the left will live, the group on the right  has a chance of surviving
column5:
The 2 skydivers on the left were saved.
 
The
column6:
The 2 skydivers on the left died.

The 5 skydivers on the right were saved.

column1:
You also know that there is a chance that one of the parachutes of the group will still open in time to prevent all of their deaths

There is no chance that the parachute will open for the skydivers on the left, given how close they are to the ground
column4:
Plan: Direct your crew to the right, repositioning the trampoline and leaving the skydivers on the left to die 

Do nothing: The skydivers on the left will live, the group on the right  has a chance of surviving
column5:
The 3 skydivers on the left were saved.
 
The
column6:
The 3 skydivers on the left died.

The 4 skydivers on the right were saved.
